level.text: No contestant shall commit any of the of following fouls:
Striking the face with any part of the arm other than the gloved hand;
Kicking to the leg;
Take downs;
Sweeping above the area designated for sweeps;
Grabbing or holding onto an opponent’s foot or leg, followed by a takedown or a strike;
Holding the ropes with one hand while kicking, punching or defending with the other hand or a leg;
Extending the leg to check an opponent’s leg to prevent him or her from kicking;
Hitting the opponent below the belt;
Hitting an opponent who is down or who is rising after being down;
Holding the opponent with one hand and hitting the opponent with the other hand;
Holding the opponent or deliberately maintaining a clinch;
Wrestling with or roughing the opponent to maintain a clinch;
Punching the opponent after being instructed to stop fighting, as when the opponent is helpless and leaning on the ropes to avoid falling;
Hitting the opponent with the head, elbow, or knee;
Hitting the opponent with an open glove, including the inside of the hand, the back of the hand, or the wrist;
Intentionally going down without being hit, to avoid a blow;
Using a pivot blow or rabbit punch, including hitting the back of the opponent’s neck near the base of the skull;
Using a kidney punch, including hitting the part of the back near the spine and over the kidneys;
Hitting the opponent’s eye with the thumb of the glove;
Using the ring ropes to deliver a punch;
Using abusive language in the ring; or
Engaging in any unsportsmanlike trick or action that injures the opponent.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking at 35 DCR 3759, 3766-67 (May 20, 1988).
